flag-bit.name: move_state
flag-bit.comment: Can the dwarf move or are they waiting for their movement timer

flag-bit.name: dead
flag-bit.comment: Dead (might also be set for incoming/leaving critters that are alive)

flag-bit.name: marauder
flag-bit.comment: wide class of invader/inside creature attackers

flag-bit.name: forest
flag-bit.comment: used for units no longer linked to merchant/diplomacy, they just try to leave mostly

flag-bit.name: can_swap
flag-bit.comment: Can swap tiles during movement (prevents multiple swaps)

flag-bit.name: on_ground
flag-bit.comment: The creature is laying on the floor, can be conscious

flag-bit.name: invader_origin
flag-bit.comment: Invader origin (could be inactive and fleeing)

flag-bit.name: coward
flag-bit.comment: Will flee if invasion turns around

flag-bit.name: invades
flag-bit.comment: Marauder resident/invader moving in all the way

flag-bit.name: check_flows
flag-bit.comment: Check against flows next time you get a chance

flag-bit.name: no_notify
flag-bit.comment: Do not notify about level gains (for embark etc)

flag-bit.name: killed
flag-bit.comment: Has been killed by kill function (slightly different from dead, not necessarily violent death)

flag-bit.name: cleanup_1
flag-bit.comment: Must be forgotten by forget function (just cleanup)

flag-bit.name: locked_in_for_trading
flag-bit.comment: Locked in for trading (it's a projectile on the other set of flags, might be what the flying was)

flag-bit.name: cleanup_4
flag-bit.comment: Marked for special cleanup as unused load from unit block on disk

flag-bit.name: stuck_weapon_computed
flag-bit.comment: cleared if removing StuckIn item to recompute wound flags.

flag-bit.name: compute_health
flag-bit.comment: causes the health structure to be created or updated

flag-bit.name: announce_titan
flag-bit.comment: Announces creature like an FB or titan.

flag-bit.name: body_temp_in_range
flag-bit.comment: Is set to 1 every tick for non-dead creatures.

flag-bit.name: wait_until_reveal
flag-bit.comment: Blocks all kind of things until tile is revealed.

flag-bit.name: scuttle
flag-bit.comment: Scuttle creature: causes creature to be killed, leaving a behind corpse and generating negative thoughts like a real kill.

enum-item.name: WildUntamed
enum-item.comment: Seems to be used as default when not flags1.tame

compound.name: idle_area
compound.comment: E.g. for a dead miner, holds the place where he was likely hanging around when he got the command to mine in an aquifer.

compound.name: patrol_route
compound.comment: used by necromancers for corpse locations, siegers etc

int32_t.name: leave_countdown
int32_t.comment: once 0, it heads for the edge and leaves

int32_t.name: vanish_countdown
int32_t.comment: once 0, it vanishes in a puff of smoke

struct-type.compound: This was used by a vampire scared of cave creatures and doing FleeFromOpponent panic
This should be a static-array, size 10, with index-enum unit_relationship_type; will likely need to fix plugins and scripts

stl-vector.name: corpse_parts
stl-vector.comment: entries remain even when items are destroyed

int32_t.name: mood_timeout
int32_t.comment: counts down from 50000, insanity upon reaching zero

int32_t.name: infection_level
int32_t.comment: GETS_INFECTIONS_FROM_ROT sets; DISEASE_RESISTANCE reduces; >=300 causes bleeding

uint32_t.name: stored_fat
uint32_t.comment: hunger leads to death only when 0

struct-type.compound:
-- average of the following vector
-- up to 50 locations where jobs were performed recently by the unit

int32_t.name: hist_figure_id2
int32_t.comment: used for ghost in AttackedByDead thought

uint32_t.name: add_path_flags
uint32_t.comment: pathing flags to OR, set to 0 after move

struct-type.compound:
-- Sorted by type:
-- Seems to be incremented every new infection:
-- Garbage when the matching vector is empty:

stl-vector.name: used_items
stl-vector.comment: Contains worn clothes, armor, weapons, arrows fired by archers

stl-string.name: adjective
stl-string.comment: from physical descriptions for use in adv

enum.name: type2
enum.comment: seems to have same value as type

enum-item.name: Pet
enum-item.comment: Left shoulder, right shoulder, or head, selected randomly using pet_seed

int32_t.name: improve_counter
int32_t.comment: counts to PHYS_ATT_RATES improve cost; then value++

int32_t.name: unused_counter
int32_t.comment: counts to PHYS_ATT_RATES unused rate; then rust_counter++

int32_t.name: rust_counter
int32_t.comment: counts to PHYS_ATT_RATES rust; then demotion_counter++

int32_t.name: demotion_counter
int32_t.comment: counts to PHYS_ATT_RATES demotion; then value--; soft_demotion++

struct-type.bitfield:
cause rq_diagnosis:
prevent rq_diagnosis or needs_healthcare:

stl-vector.name: parts
stl-vector.pointer:
Contact area of the wound. Is initially the lesser of the weapon or body part contact areas. It grows with cumulative hits. Body parts and non-weapon items have contact=(size/10)^(2/3).
This is strain. For skin/muscle/fat it is usually around 50000, and for bone 100-113. This number heals over time towards 0. A wound that only has strain is called "dented".
A random percentage from 0-100, only for edged damage cases. Otherwise 0. Values above 50 turn straight_scar description into curving scar.
exact location unknown:
This 0-100 percentage is related to cumulative damage. In cases where multiple axe hacks are necessary for severing a limb, it must reach 100 before severing occurs. In cases where a weapon can't completely penetrate a tissue, it is related to the weapon's penetration number. This percentage heals towards 0 over time.

data-definition.enum-type:
for thirsty patients for hungry patients
handled manually
data-definition.bitfield-type: due to a field initialization bug, higher bits contain garbage

flag-bit.name: needs_bandage
flag-bit.comment: used to remove once not needed

flag-bit.name: needs_cast
flag-bit.comment: used to remove once not needed

int32_t.name: focus_level
int32_t.comment: goes to 400 when unit satisfies need

int32_t.name: need_level
int32_t.comment: how fast focus_level decreases when it below 0

flag-bit.name: has_unmet_needs
flag-bit.comment: focus_level is below -999 for at least one need

pointer.name: temporary_trait_changes
pointer.comment: sum of inebriation or so personality changing effects

int32_t.name: undistracted_focus
int32_t.comment: usually number of needs multiplied by 4

uint32_t.name: prefstring_seed
uint32_t.comment: feeds into a simple RNG to choose which prefstring to use
